intro: Hieracium smolandicum subsp. thyrsophorum, commonly known as the Sørensen's hawkweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to northern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow flowers arranged in a thyrse. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has hairy stems and lanceolate leaves that are often glandular-dotted. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
